isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Orifice Tube System, Pre-March 2007 - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500, 8600 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - ACTUATOR, (FRESH/RECIRCULATE) AIR DOOR

note.para: Refer to Figure 28 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

step1.para: Disconnect wiring connector to actuator motor (1) for fresh/recirc air door.

figure.caption: Figure 28. Actuator for Fresh/Recirc Air Door

step1.para: Remove two screws securing actuator (1) to evaporator housing (2).

caution.para: In the following step, never force the actuator drive collar into position. If the drive collar position must be changed, follow the following procedures. Forcing the drive collar may result in a broken actuator.

step1.para: It may be necessary to align the actuator drive collar to the door shaft before the actuator can be installed. If alignment is necessary:

step2.para: Place the actuator into its approximate position.
Connect a 9 Volt battery across pins A and F of the actuator connector, to rotate the drive collar. (Reverse the connection to rotate the drive collar in the opposite direction.)
Allow the drive collar to rotate until it is aligned with the door shaft, and the actuator mounting screws can be inserted. Then, disconnect 9 Volt battery.

step1.para: Install actuator (1) on evaporator housing (2) using two screws.
Connect wiring connector to actuator motor for fresh/recirc air door.

Recalibrate the fresh/recirc air door by disconnecting the HVAC control panel assembly for at least 15 seconds. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, HVAC CONTROL PANEL ASSEMBLY
.
